meta.title: Caliptra - Building trust, one chip at a time
meta.description: Caliptra is a project for implementing a Root of Trust for Measurement (RTM) block inside an SoC.

hero.title: Caliptra: Building trust, one chip at a time
hero.description: Caliptra consists of IP and firmware for an integrated Root of Trust block. It targets datacenter-class SoCs like CPUs, GPUs, DPUs, TPUs. It is the specification, silicon logic, ROM and firmware for implementing a Root of Trust for Measurement (RTM) block inside an SoC.

sections.title: Targeting datacenter-class SoCs
paragraphs: A Root of Trust is a critical security component for datacenter-class SoCs including CPUs, GPUs, DPUs, and TPUs.
Caliptra provides a secure foundation for these devices.

buttons.text: Explore Root of Trust for SoCs

sections.title: Open and vendor-neutral
paragraphs: Caliptra is an open-source project developed as part of the CHIPS Alliance, ensuring transparency and interoperability. The Caliptra community continues to grow and now includes 9elements, AMI, Antmicro, ASPEED, Axiado, Lubis EDA, ScaleFlux, Marvell and Nuvoton, who together have significant domain expertise across SoC design automation, firmware, and verification.

sections.title: From spec to silicon
paragraphs: Caliptra provides a complete implementation path from specification to silicon, including RTL, firmware, and documentation.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Get answers to the most common questions about Caliptra

questions.question: What is a Root of Trust?
questions.answer: A Root of Trust (RoT) is the foundation of security in a system. It's a hardware component that is inherently trusted and can't be altered. It serves as the starting point for establishing a chain of trust throughout the system, validating each component before it executes.

questions.question: How does Caliptra integrate into an SoC?
questions.answer: Caliptra is designed to be integrated as an IP block within an SoC design. It provides RTL that can be incorporated into the silicon design process, along with firmware that runs on the integrated hardware to provide root of trust capabilities.

questions.question: What makes Caliptra different from other Root of Trust solutions?
questions.answer: Caliptra is an open-source, vendor-neutral solution developed collaboratively by industry leaders. This approach ensures transparency, interoperability across platforms, and broad industry adoption, unlike proprietary solutions that may be limited to specific vendors or ecosystems.

questions.question: What security features does Caliptra provide?
questions.answer: Caliptra provides several key security features including establishing cryptographic identity for hardware components, measured boot capabilities that record the boot process, and hardware attestation that allows the hardware to prove its authenticity and integrity to higher-level software.

questions.question: How can I contribute to the Caliptra project?
questions.answer: Caliptra is an open-source project under the CHIPS Alliance. You can contribute by submitting pull requests, reporting issues, or joining discussions on the project's GitHub repositories.
